simulator

Class PlantController

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulator.PlantController

  • public class PlantController
extends java.lang.Object
    PlantController is the "controller" of the MVC design of the game. It has methods necessary to control the data held in Plant, to execute methods that relate to UI functions, to give information about the Plant to an UI.

      private UIData uidata

      Adds a new score to high scores if the new score is in the top 10 of all scores.

      Iterates through all ConnectorPipes in the system and propagates the blockage, if all outputs of that ConnectorPipe is blocked.

      Returns true if all outputs of a ConnectorPipe are blocked.
      private boolean isPathTo(PlantComponent start, PlantComponent goal, boolean forwards)
      Returns true if there exists a path from start to goal that is not blocked and does not pass through a pressurised component (Reactor/Condenser) in the direction that is specified.
      private void limitReactorFlowDueToValveMaxFlow(Reactor reactor)
      Sums up the maximum flow possible through all valves that have a clear backward path to the reactor and if this maximum flow is greater than the amount of steam wanting to come out of the reactor due to pressue, the rate is limited.

      Loads the state of the current game (plant) from a file called "save.ser" inside the current folder.

      Iterates through connector pipes, calculates their flow out & if it has changed, propagate this new flow forward to the next connector pipe.

      Start off propagation of the flow from the reactor to the next ConnectorPipe encountered.

      Propagates the flow rate and temperature to every component from startComponent until a ConnectorPipe is encountered.
      private void propagateNoFlowBackToReactor()
      If all paths out of the reactor are blocked and the reactor is connected to a ConnectorPipe, then the 'zero flow' will not have been propagated back to it's flowOut.

    • Method Detail

      • newGame

        public void newGame(java.lang.String operatorName)
        Creates a new Game - used in UI to start a new game.
        Parameters:
        operatorName - the name of the player

      • saveGame

        public boolean saveGame()
        Saves the state of the current game (plant) into a file called "save.ser" inside the current folder.
        Returns:
        true if saving a game was successful, false otherwise.

      • loadGame

        public boolean loadGame()
        Loads the state of the current game (plant) from a file called "save.ser" inside the current folder. If the file does not exist, the load will not be successful (nothing will happen).
        Returns:
        true if loading a game was successful, false otherwise.

      • togglePaused

        public void togglePaused()
        Pauses/resumes the game on call. Currently not in used as the game is turn based. Gives the possibility to easily create a real-time game.

      • getHighScores

        public java.util.List<HighScore> getHighScores()
        Returns the highscores list.
        Returns:
        list of highscores.

      • addHighScore

        public boolean addHighScore(HighScore newHighScore)
        Adds a new score to high scores if the new score is in the top 10 of all scores.
        Returns:
        true if adding was successful and the new score is in top 10, false otherwise.

      • setValve

        public boolean setValve(int valveID,
               boolean open)
        Returns true if command was successful, false if a valve with that ID was not found
        Returns:
        true if command was successful, false if a valve with that ID was not found

      • setPumpOnOff

        public boolean setPumpOnOff(int pumpID,
                   boolean on)
        Returns true if command was successful, false if a pump with that ID was not found
        Returns:
        true if command was successful, false if a pump with that ID was not found

      • setPumpRpm

        public boolean setPumpRpm(int pumpID,
                 int rpm)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the RPM of a particular pump.
        Parameters:
        pumpID - the internal ID of the pump.
        rpm - the new value of the RPM, needs to be in range (0 to MAX_RPM).
        Returns:
        true if setting the RPM was successful, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if RPM is out of the allowed range (rpm < 0 || rpm > MAX_RPM).

      • setControlRods

        public void setControlRods(int percentageLowered)
        Sets a new percentage for the control rods. Setting the percentage to 100 means that the control rods are fully inside the reactor and the reaction stops. Setting the percentage to 0 means that the control rods are outside of the reactor.
        Parameters:
        percentageLowered - the new value of percentageLowered

      • repairTurbine

        public boolean repairTurbine()
        Start the repair of the turbine if it has failed.
        Returns:
        true only if the turbine has failed and is not already being repaired.

      • repairPump

        public boolean repairPump(int pumpID)
        Start the repair of a particular pump.
        Parameters:
        pumpID - the internal ID of the pump to be repaired.
        Returns:
        true only if the pump is found, has failed and is not already being repaired.

      • step

        public void step(int numSteps)
        Advance the game by a number of time steps. If the game reaches a game over state before all steps are executed, the game stops stepping.
        Parameters:
        numSteps - number of timesteps to advance the game by.

      • getUIData

        public UIData getUIData()
        Return the current UIData object related to the plant.
        Returns:
        the current UIData object related to the plant.

      • getPlant

        public Plant getPlant()

      • writeHighScores

        private void writeHighScores()
        Writes all highscores currently inside plant to a file called "highscores.ser".

      • readHighScores

        private void readHighScores()
        Loads all saved highscores from a file called "highscore.ser" to plant's highscores list.

      • gameOver

        private void gameOver()
        Sets the game over state of the plant and adds the score of the player to "highscores" if it's big enough.

      • printDebugInfo

        private void printDebugInfo()
        Prints debug info to the console.

      • printFlowDebugInfo

        private void printFlowDebugInfo()
        Prints debug info related to the flow of the plant to the console.

      • updatePlant

        private void updatePlant()
        Go through all components and call updateState() then calculates the current score.

      • updateBeingRepaired

        private void updateBeingRepaired()
        Updates the state of the components that are being repaired. Decreases the number of steps left until a component's repairing is completed. Then checks all components and if they are finished repairing and take appropriate actions if that is the case (remove from lists of failed components and set to operational).

      • checkFailures

        private void checkFailures()
        Goes through all components and check for failures. If more than one component fails, only one is actually getting broken. If a reactor or condenser is broken, then the game is over.

      • updateFlow

        private void updateFlow()
        Highest level method for updating flow. This method calls all other methods necessary for propagating flow, as well as blockages, throughout the system. In this order, we: - Set all outputs of all ConnectorPipes to not blocked. - Propagate blockages from all closed valves in the system back to their first preceding ConnectorPipe. - Propagate all blockages throughout the entire system. - Set the flow rate and temperature of all components to zero in preparation for flow calculation & propagation. - Calculate and propagate the flow from the reactor forward. - Calculate the flow due to the pumps in the system and totals them up at the condenser output. - Propagate the flow out of the condenser forwards. - Propagate flow through all paths in the system. - Transfer steam from the reactor into the condenser. - Transfer water from the condenser into the reactor.

      • moveWater

        private void moveWater()
        Moves water out of the condenser and into the reactor due to the flow in and out of the components.

      • moveSteam

        private void moveSteam()
        Forcefully removes steam from the reactor and places it into the condenser. Based upon the flow! :)

      • propagateNoFlowBackToReactor

        private void propagateNoFlowBackToReactor()
        If all paths out of the reactor are blocked and the reactor is connected to a ConnectorPipe, then the 'zero flow' will not have been propagated back to it's flowOut. We therefore need to check whether or not

      • setAllConnectorPipesUnblocked

        private void setAllConnectorPipesUnblocked()
        Resets all ConnectorPipe paths to unblocked. We do this to all ConnectorPipes at the beginning of each updatePlant() before propagating the blockages since valves can change state between steps.

      • blockFromValves

        private void blockFromValves()
        Iterates through all valves in the system and if they are closed we propagate the blockage through to the next preceding ConnectorPipe.

      • blockFromConnectorPipes

        private void blockFromConnectorPipes()
        Iterates through all ConnectorPipes in the system and propagates the blockage, if all outputs of that ConnectorPipe is blocked. This is done until all blocked ConnectorPipes have had their blockage propagated.

      • isConnectorBlocking

        private boolean isConnectorBlocking(ConnectorPipe cp)
        Returns true if all outputs of a ConnectorPipe are blocked.
        Returns:
        true if all outputs of a ConnectorPipe are blocked.

      • blockToPrecedingConnectorPipe

        private void blockToPrecedingConnectorPipe(PlantComponent blockedComponent)
        Traces back to the first occurring connector pipe and blocks the path out leading to blockedComponent. We assume checks have been made to ensure blockedComponent is actually blocked.
        Parameters:
        blockedComponent - component to start from.

      • blockPrecedingFromConnectorPipe

        private void blockPrecedingFromConnectorPipe(ConnectorPipe blockedConnector)
        Calls blockPrecedingConnectorPipe() for all input paths into blockedConnector. We assume checks have been made to ensure blockedConnector is actually blocked. If an input is a ConnectorPipe, set the output that blockedConnector is connected to blocked.
        Parameters:
        blockedConnector - the blocked ConnectorPipe to start from.

      • resetFlowAllComponents

        private void resetFlowAllComponents()
        Resets the flow of all components back ready for the flow around the system to be recalculated for the current state of the plant.

      • propagateFlowFromReactor

        private void propagateFlowFromReactor()
        Start off propagation of the flow from the reactor to the next ConnectorPipe encountered.

      • limitReactorFlowDueToValveMaxFlow

        private void limitReactorFlowDueToValveMaxFlow(Reactor reactor)
        Sums up the maximum flow possible through all valves that have a clear backward path to the reactor and if this maximum flow is greater than the amount of steam wanting to come out of the reactor due to pressue, the rate is limited.
        Parameters:
        reactor - the reactor to limit.

      • calcReactorFlowOut

        private int calcReactorFlowOut()
        Calculate and return the flow of steam out of the reactor due to the difference in steam volume between the reactor and condenser. This method ignores any blockages, these are dealt with when the flow is propagated around the system.
        Returns:
        rate of flow of steam out of the reactor.

      • propagateFlowFromConnectorPipes

        private void propagateFlowFromConnectorPipes()
        Iterates through connector pipes, calculates their flow out & if it has changed, propagate this new flow forward to the next connector pipe. Do this until nothing in the system changes (Inspired by bubble sort's changed flag... "Good Ol' Bubble Sort!")

      • propagateFlowToNextConnectorPipe

        private void propagateFlowToNextConnectorPipe(PlantComponent startComponent)
        Propagates the flow rate and temperature to every component from startComponent until a ConnectorPipe is encountered.
        Parameters:
        startComponent - Component to start the propagation from.

      • propagateFlowFromConnectorPipe

        private void propagateFlowFromConnectorPipe(ConnectorPipe startConnectorPipe)
        Propagates calls the appropriate methods for all unblocked outputs of startConnectorPipe in order to propagate flow through the system.
        Parameters:
        startConnectorPipe - The ConnectorPipe to propagate flow onward from.

      • calcConnectorFlowOut

        private void calcConnectorFlowOut(ConnectorPipe connector)
        Update the Flow out of a connector to reflect it's inputs and outputs.
        Parameters:
        connector - the connector to update.

      • propagateFlowFromCondenser

        private void propagateFlowFromCondenser()
        Set's off the propagation from the condenser to the next ConnectorPipe from it's output.

      • propagateFlowFromPumpsToCondenser

        private void propagateFlowFromPumpsToCondenser()
        Tracks back from a pump and if there is a clear path to the condenser adds the flow increase at this pump to the flow out of the condenser. This method does not support multiple condensers.

      • increaseCondenserFlowOutFromPump

        private void increaseCondenserFlowOutFromPump(Pump p)
        Gets the flowRate due to this pump from it's current rpm. Then checks if there is a path from Pump p to the connector (backwards) and if there is, we add the flow rate due to this pump to the flow rate out of the condenser.
        Parameters:
        p - Pump to increase the flow out of the condenser due to.

      • isPathTo

        private boolean isPathTo(PlantComponent start,
               PlantComponent goal,
               boolean forwards)
        Returns true if there exists a path from start to goal that is not blocked and does not pass through a pressurised component (Reactor/Condenser) in the direction that is specified. If forwards = true then the path with be traced using outputs, otherwise inputs.
        Parameters:
        start - Component to start from.
        goal - Component to attempt to reach.
        forwards - Direction of the path
        Returns:
        true if there exists a path from start to goal that is not blocked and does not pass through a pressurised component in the direction that is specified.

      • calcFlowFromPumpRpm

        private int calcFlowFromPumpRpm(Pump p)
        Calculates the flow through a pump based upon it's rpm. The flow is linearly correlated to the rpm.
        Parameters:
        p - The pump to calculate the rpm of.
        Returns:
        The flow rate through pump, p.
